section.title: Adam System Requirements.
section.p: To successfully run Java JDK and above is required. is a Doclet which runs within the Javadoc framework, which is only supplied with the JDK installations.
If the Ant task is to be used, then the demos / examples were built using Ant verison Earlier versions may work.
If using 1.6 or greater, then tools.jar from the JDK lib directory may need to be added to the class path. This is not required for the eclipse plugin.

section.title: Taglet System Requirements.
section.p: To successfully run these Taglets it requires Java JDK and above. Taglets runs within the Javadoc framework, which is only supplied with the JDK installations.
If the Ant task is to be used, then the demos / examples were built using Ant version Earlier versions may work.

section.title: Eclipse System Requirements.
section.p: To successfully run Eclipse Plugin it requires Eclipse 4.2 (Juno) or above and Java JDK 1.6 or above.

section.title: Javadoc to DITA system requirements
section.p: To successfully run Java JDK and above is required. is a Doclet which runs within the Javadoc framework, which is only supplied with the JDK installations.
If the Ant task is to be used, then the demos / examples were built using Ant verison Earlier versions may work.
If using 1.6 or greater, then tools.jar from the JDK lib directory may need to be added to the class path. This is not required if running from eclipse.
As no specialisation is required, DITA 1.2 version is supported.

section.title: Beermat System Requirements.
section.p: If using OSX and Java 1.7, then due to an bug within the JDK. the minimum Java release is 1.7u40 will be required as well as Eclipse 4.3 (Kepler)

section.title: JAXB Plugin System Requirements.
section.p: The JAXB plugins require at least Java and above. The JAXB framework that these plugins were built against was JAXB RI You may have to reference this implementation if this is not the standard included with your JDK. This implementation can be found here and you may have to use -Djava.endorsed.dirs on the java command if you are not using the same reference implementation as
